001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.storage;
002
003import com.jayway.jsonpath.JsonPath;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.DataExtractor;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.storage.DataExtractorImpl;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.interceptor.ApiResponse;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.util.table.TableReflectionUtil;
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.HashSet;
010import java.util.List;
011
012/**
013 * Utility class providing data extraction mechanisms for UI-related data storage and retrieval.
014 *
015 * <p>This class contains static methods for extracting data from API responses and table elements.
016 * It provides functionalities to:
017 * <ul>
018 *   <li>Extract JSON data from stored API responses.</li>
019 *   <li>Retrieve specific table rows based on search criteria or index.</li>
020 *   <li>Process and filter data for validation and assertions.</li>
021 * </ul>
022 *
023 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
024 */
025public class DataExtractorsUi {
026
027   private DataExtractorsUi() {
028   }
029
030   /**
031    * Creates a {@link DataExtractor} to retrieve a value from a stored API response body using a JSONPath expression.
032    *
033    * @param responsePrefix The prefix of the API response URL used to filter relevant responses.
034    * @param jsonPath       The JSONPath expression used to extract data from the response body.
035    * @param <T>            The expected return type of the extracted data.
036    * @return A {@link DataExtractor} that retrieves the specified value from the API response.
037    */
038   public static <T> DataExtractor<T> responseBodyExtraction(String responsePrefix, String jsonPath) {
039      return responseBodyExtraction(responsePrefix, jsonPath, 1);
040   }
041
042   /**
043    * Creates a {@link DataExtractor} to retrieve a value from a stored API response body using a JSONPath expression.
044    *
045    * @param responsePrefix The prefix of the API response URL used to filter relevant responses.
046    * @param jsonPath       The JSONPath expression used to extract data from the response body.
047    * @param index          The index (from the most recent) of the filtered API responses to extract data from.
048    * @param <T>            The expected return type of the extracted data.
049    * @return A {@link DataExtractor} that retrieves the specified value from the API response.
050    * @throws IllegalArgumentException If the provided index is out of range.
051    */
052   public static <T> DataExtractor<T> responseBodyExtraction(String responsePrefix, String jsonPath, int index) {
053      return new DataExtractorImpl<>(
054            StorageKeysUi.UI,
055            StorageKeysUi.RESPONSES,
056            raw -> {
057               List<ApiResponse> responses = (List<ApiResponse>) raw;
058
059               List<ApiResponse> filteredResponses = responses.stream()
060                     .filter(
061                           response -> response.getUrl().startsWith(responsePrefix))
062                     .toList();
063
064               int adjustedIndex = filteredResponses.size() - index;
065               if (adjustedIndex < 0 || adjustedIndex >= filteredResponses.size()) {
066                  throw new IllegalArgumentException("Invalid index for response list.");
067               }
068
069               ApiResponse selectedResponse = filteredResponses.get(adjustedIndex);
070
071               return JsonPath.read(selectedResponse.getBody(), jsonPath);
072            }
073      );
074   }
075
076
077   /**
078    * Creates a {@link DataExtractor} to retrieve a specific table row from storage based on search criteria.
079    *
080    * <p>This method searches stored table data for a row containing all specified indicator values.
081    * It compares row values case-insensitively after trimming whitespace.
082    *
083    * @param key        The key used to retrieve the stored table data.
084    * @param indicators The values used to search for a matching row.
085    * @param <T>        The expected return type of the extracted table row.
086    * @return A {@link DataExtractor} that retrieves the matching row from the table.
087    */
088   public static <T> DataExtractor<T> tableRowExtractor(Enum<?> key, String... indicators) {
089      return new DataExtractorImpl<>(
090            StorageKeysUi.UI,
091            key,
092            raw -> {
093               List<T> rows = new ArrayList<>();
094               if (List.class.isAssignableFrom(raw.getClass())) {
095                  rows = (List<T>) raw;
096               } else {
097                  rows.add((T) raw);
098               }
099
100               return rows.stream().filter(row -> {
101                  List<String> rowValues = TableReflectionUtil.extractTextsFromRow(row);
102                  List<String> modifiedRowValues = TableReflectionUtil.lowerCaseAndTrim(rowValues);
103                  List<String> modifiedIndicators = TableReflectionUtil.lowerCaseAndTrim(List.of(indicators));
104                  return new HashSet<>(modifiedRowValues).containsAll(modifiedIndicators);
105               }).findFirst().orElse(null);
106            }
107      );
108   }
109
110   /**
111    * Creates a {@link DataExtractor} to retrieve a specific table row from storage based on its index.
112    *
113    * @param key   The key used to retrieve the stored table data.
114    * @param index The zero-based index of the row to retrieve.
115    * @param <T>   The expected return type of the extracted table row.
116    * @return A {@link DataExtractor} that retrieves the row at the specified index.
117    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If the index is out of range.
118    */
119   public static <T> DataExtractor<T> tableRowExtractor(Enum<?> key, int index) {
120      return new DataExtractorImpl<>(
121            StorageKeysUi.UI,
122            key,
123            raw -> {
124               List<T> rows = new ArrayList<>();
125               if (List.class.isAssignableFrom(raw.getClass())) {
126                  rows = (List<T>) raw;
127               } else {
128                  rows.add((T) raw);
129               }
130
131               return rows.get(index);
132            }
133      );
134   }
135
136}
